lead_paragraph: A rookie running back on a pace for 1,380 yards and 10 touchdowns would usually be a big story at the midpoint of the season, but Buffalo’s Marshawn Lynch is not. Instead of receiving attention as a rookie of the year contender, he is playing in the shadow of Minnesota’s Adrian Peterson.
